column4: Bidget; you could look in X Server Display Configuration in Nvidia-settings to see if you can move the Layout of the tv monitor down

Bidget; then the resolution your card is pushing to the tv is not big enough, with component it does not resample the image and displays the exact resolution, if your tv is 1280x1024 but your card pushed 800x600 then it will have blank spots
Bidget; using an S-Video cable will fix the problem.
Bidget; you'll need to get the tv resolution set correctly, otherwise you'll have blank spots.
her tv is a standard one.. not a plasma or lcd.. difficult to believe that a standard tv could display 1280x1024 but it might if it was real quality
she's using twinview and would like to setup xinerama..
acovrig vinagre
you need  'service' ?
if you don't then there are 3 ways to do it.. sudo gdm stop / sudo service gdm stop / sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop ..
gotcha. thanks
how did you install Namoroko? a .tar.gz?
you should be able to apt-get remove firefox (if the package is firefox) then remove the ppa and apt-get update then apt-get upgrade then reinstall firefox ..
I'll give it a shot.. I was thinking along the same lines..

ok.. uninstalled Namoroka(FF) .. disabled the PPA.. updated, upgraded, dist-upgraded.. looked in synaptic and see several versions of FF .. installed FF 3.0.. renamed .mozilla to .mozilla.backup and FF won't start.. tries but doesn't start.
any errors when trying to start firefox from a terminal?
I'll check
they have firefox-3.5 in the repo's.
3.5 shows but isn't installable.. this is on Hardy.. error starting from terminal is "Could not find compatible GRE between version 1.9.0.1 and 1.9.0.*
from googling i found this as a possible solution.. sudo xulrunner-1.9 --register-global
did that help?
almost.. it asked for multiple options.. so instead I uninstalled xulrunner (2 versions) and then installed FF which pulled the right version of xul..and configured it.
later I'll play with java and get that going.. thanks for the help.
good luck
